newsitem.title: CZECH REPUBLIC: Czech Pragobanka starts payout of Kreditni clients.
newsitem.headline: Czech Pragobanka starts payout of Kreditni clients.

text.p: Czech bank Pragobanka a.s., majority-owned by insurer Ceska Pojistovna a.s., said on Monday it had started compensating clients of failed Kreditni Banka a.s..
Pragobanka said in a statement that, in line with earlier decisions, private and corporate depositors of Kreditni would be paid up to four million crowns each for their deposits.
"Pragobanka will pay out deposits in the total volume of over two billion crowns to the 46,000 clients of Kreditni Banka," the statement said.
It added that 580 million crowns of that amount would come from the Deposit Insurance Fund.
The Czech National Bank (CNB) pulled Kreditni's licence last month after the bank suffered an estimated 12 billion loss due to murky securities trades and bad loans.

Six executives of the bank have been charged in connection with the case which became a political battle when opposition Social Democrats blamed the governemnt and the central bank for failing to keep the banking sector under control.
Kreditni was the country's 11th bank to become the subject of CNB intervention.

Kreditni's failure led to liquidity problems at the fifth largest and the biggest fully-private bank, Agrobanka a.s., prompting the temporary installation of a CNB forced administrator at the bank last week.
